name: Mohammad Mannan
content: Mohammad Mannan: Concordia University Mohammad Mannan Professor Concordia Institute for Information Systems Engineering (CIISE) Concordia University, Montreal, Canada Postal: CIISE, EV7.640, 1455 De Maisonneuve Blvd. West, Montreal, QC, Canada H3G 1M8 Office: EV9.189, 1515 Ste-Catherine Street West, Montreal, QC, Canada H3G 2W1 Phone: 514-848-2424 ext. 8972 Email: m.mannan@concordia.ca Biography: Brief bio Publications Students Press Madiba Research Interests I am primarily interested in real-world systems security and privacy - how security systems miserably fail in reality, and how to design systems to survive against advanced attacks. Some topics of interest include: Android/iOS, IoT, cloud/CDN, CPS and hardware security; anti-surveillance tools; authentication; privacy; usable security; ransomware, phishing, and financial security. External Funding Support Over the years, my research has been funded by several organizations. I am thankful to all of them. Selected list of grants: NSERC Discovery Grant, OPC Contributions Program, CIRA Community Investment Program, Mitacs Accelerate (with Ericsson and Irdeto), NSERC Engage Grant (with Huawei and Irdeto), FQRNT, and Concordia University.
